content: स्कंधः [स्कद्यते आरुह्यतेऽसौ सुखेन शाखया वा कर्मणि घञ् पृषो°; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Uṇ. 4. 206</ls>] {@--1@} The shoulder. {@--2@} The body. {@--3@} The trunk or stem of a tree; तीव्राघातप्रतिहततरुस्कंधलग्नैकदंतः <ls>Ś. 1. 33</ls>; <ls>R. 4. 57</ls>, <ls>Me. 53.</ls> {@--4@} A branch or large bough. {@--5@} A department or branch of human knowledge. {@--6@} A chapter, section, division (of a book). {@--7@} A division or detachment of an army. {@--8@} A troop, multitude, group. {@--9@} The five objects of sense. {@--10@} The five forms of mundane consciousness (in Buddhistic <ab>phil.</ab>); सर्वकार्यशरीरेषु मुक्त्वांगस्कंधपंचकं <ls>Śi. 2. 28.</ls> {@--11@} War, battle. {@--12@} A king. {@--13@} An agreement. {@--14@} A road, way. {@--15@} A wise or learned man. {@--16@} A heron. {@--17@} Articles used at the coronation of a king. --धा {@--1@} A branch. {@--2@} A creeper.
